title: Drawing, 1969-165-304, 1957–60
inscribed: In upper right corner in red pencil, a small sketch for a design
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Six geometric patterns grouped on one sheet: pinwheel (pink, blue and green triangles); interlocking "L" shape (green, pink, blue, yellow); 3 crossed rectangles with circles (pink, blue, yellow); overlapping triangles (green, pink, blue, yellow).
